DOC.brief_summary: We determined the effects of dietary intervention (replacement of refined rice with whole grains and legumes and a high intake of vegetables) on circulating Lp-PLA2 activity and enzyme activity in peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) in patients with impaired fasting glucose (IFG), impaired glucose tolerance (IGT) or newly-diagnosed type 2 diabetes.
DOC.brief_title: Dietary Effects on Circulating Lipoprotein-associated Phospholipase A2 (Lp-PLA2) Activity and Enzyme Activity in Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells (PBMCs) in Patients With Prediabetes or Newly Diagnosed Type 2 Diabetes
DOC.detailed_description: Ninety-nine patients with impaired fasting glucose (IFG), impaired glucose tolerance (IGT) or newly-diagnosed type 2 diabetes were randomly assigned to either a control group (usual diet with refined rice) or the whole grain group.
DOC.criteria: Subjects who were in in impaired fasting glucose (IFG, 100≤ fasting glucose <126 mg/dL) or newly diagnosed type 2 diabetes (fasting glucose ≥126 mg/dL) current and/or past history of cardiovascular disease including angina liver or kidney dysfunction thyroid or pituitary disease unstable weight loss/gain (≥2 kg) over the previous 12 months pregnancy or lactation taking medications or supplements
